item.title: [Python] I couldn't escape from the futon, so I made a fully automatic futon peeler.
item.description: # Overview It is known that escaping from the futon by itself on a cold winter morning is accompanied by a great deal of mental distress, and a decline in activity in the morning in the winter brings a great loss to the Japanese economy. item.title: [Python] Easy IoT to start with Razpai and MESH
item.description: Ubiregi Advent Calendar 2019 On the 4th day, we will introduce easy IoT using Razpai and MESH. What to make We make a very simple thing: pressing a “button” on the MESH block will post a fixed message to Slack. As an application, I attach a monitor to Raspberry Pi and use it as an intercom. I think that I would like to see it. While living alone, there is a problem that I do not know if people are visiting while I am away, so if I put a MESH button instead, it seems like I can notify the smartphone that a person came.

item.title: [Python] A guidebook for doing IoT with MicroPython at the last minute
item.description: This article is the second day of [Python Part 2 Advent Calendar 2019](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/python2).Thefirstdaywas@ssh-22's[Advancedstringreplacementusingre.sub](https://qiita.com/ssh-22/items/a42ca0fe7ead4d280bfc). Arduino, Raspberry Pi is a rapidly growing ecosystem in the IoT area, but Raspberry Pi can be implemented in Python, but Arduino is much easier to use for a little electronic control. However, there are probably people who want to write in Python, which is familiar to them, rather than the Arduino language (like C/C++). In this article, I would like to write a guide to easily start development using MicroPython, which is embedded Python, in a financial sense.

item.title: [Python] I installed the IoT platform Rimotte
item.description: ### What is Limotte Rimotte is an All-In-One platform for always-on apps such as IoT. It is used by using the “Station” that is installed and used on Windows and a web browser that runs on Android, iOS, Windows, MacOS, Linux, etc. Not limited to IoT, it can be used for applications that are used without being connected to the Internet, and applications such as measurement, monitoring, automation, and AI can be easily realized.
